channel.title: cshotton tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from cshotton.

item.description: @willie It's a poor craftsman that blames his tools.

@b05crypto A better answer might be to ask the IRS and perhaps the GAO (SEC? FINRA?) to get their heads out of their butts and just treat it like normal financial transactions where you pay tax on the net long or short term gains.

@BaJaeJae @MichelleOnKP @bemusedmuse @DrEricDing They detect fragments of the virus, non-viable virus, and all sorts of bits and pieces that are left AFTER an infection has been cleared. Using a home kit test to decide if you are "well" is not how you do it. They return positive results for months as your body cleans itself up.
@peternlewis I wish there was an "I'm not an idiot or a grandma -- let me use my Mac" mode. But apparently we're all too stupid to know better now. But Nanny @Apple does!
@MichelleOnKP @bemusedmuse @DrEricDing This is silly BS. It's not how they work at all. Stop spreading misinformation. These tests don't detect the virus. They test for antigens.

@DrEricDing The home tests can show positive results for a MONTH or more after infection. They're not for telling when you are well. They are for identifying that you have been infected. You need a PCR test to determine when you are no longer infected, not a home test kit.
